Reviews.Title: “Good value mid rank establishment”
Reviews.Author: Freischutz
Reviews.Content: The Atlanta is very similar to many of mid rank hotels around Kurfurstendamm. Good location; good public transport access to the rest of the city: decent breakfasts; keen price. Worthy of consideration by those not looking to stop at the city's top rank (and top price) hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; OK in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: GermanyNeedtotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend at the end of the summer for a bargain price (approx. EUR 50). Good: Location near the Kurfürstendamm, close to restaurants in the Bleibtreustrasse, excellent public transport access. Room was relatively large if somewhat loud. The bath was clean but in need of an upgrade/renovation. I found the staff helpful and friendly. The hotel was fully booked and therefore the breakfast area quite cramped, although the breakfast itself was ample, considering the price. Aound this area of Berlin there are a number of lower-priced but adequate hotels: Atlanta was neither the best nor the worst of them.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: briand2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights with a male friend. Room was small but adequate and clean. Beds very comfortable and bathroom adequate. Breakfast was provided a good selection of food and was as expected for this type of hotel. The hotel is located on a beantiful street off the K'Dam and almost opposite the well known Literashaus Restaurant. It is within easy walking distance of trains, metro, restaurants and shops. Very good value for money. I would make a comment however that the hotel is becoming dated and in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible price / service balance”
Reviews.Author: vindzhov
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, dirty everywhere, terrible breakfast, overpriced... take care that you have other alternative before this hotel or take it only in bargain, but never more then 40-50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: mylh
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for 10 days during our tourist trip to Berlin. Though the hotel looks quite old and ancient it has all the necessary facilities for comfortable stay. Breakfast is also very good and abundant. Main benefits of this hotel for us were: 1. Ideal location right on Kurfurstendamm 2. FREE parking for guest's car 3. relatively low price I would recommend this hotel for a stay as a base while exploring Berling. Also I'd like to mention very friendly personnel

Reviews.Title: “Very poor”
Reviews.Author: RichIndeed
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend trip to Berlin but only stayed here one night due to the fact that the room we received was very small and dated - if I was being very generous I would describe it as basic. We were then woken at 7 in the morning by extremely loud drilling and building work noises which made our room uninhabitable so after complaining to the staff who were either unable or unwilling to do anything to rectify the situation we checked out and stayed at the Concord instead (which I would highly recommend). It may seem cheap but you don't even get what you pay for - there are plenty of other hotels in central Berlin which offer far better quality for a similar price. Breakfast was ok though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right off Ku'damm”
Reviews.Author: AnaBeatriz
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right off Kurfurstendamm. There are three subway/ metro stations very close to the hotel and you can reach everywhere in Berlin very easily, including Tegel and Schonenfeld airports. Breakfast was fantastic, a great variety of breads, cheese and meats, fruits and juices. Staff was very friendly, always helping us out with questions and tips on what to do in the city. Room and bathroom were enormous. It looked old but everything was clean and neat during our stay. On the other hand, not wheelchair friendly, hotel reception and most rooms are on the second floor and the elevator does not get you there. Besides that fact, can recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right off the K'dam”
Reviews.Author: pdxams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Atlanta the first weekend of August 2008. Nice hotel right off the k'dam. You do have to walk up two flights of stairs to get to the reception area. We had a room with a little balcony and could see the k'dam from it. It was very warm that weekend and they have no airco. We had to go to Saturn to buy a stand up fan for 10.00 EUR so we could bear the hot room at night. Breakfast was basic, breads, cheeses, meats and hard boiled eggs. All in all, I would stay here again, maybe not when it is so hot out. Good value for hotel right off k'dam. Nice bonus is that if you drive to Berlin you can get a free parking pass to park on the street for your stay. You pay 50 eur deposit but it is refunded when you give the parking pass back at check out.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: This little family owned hotel is located at the lovely Fasenenstrasse in the city center of Berlin close to main attractions. It really is a great hotel with superb personal, breakfast and prices. It was clean, quite and just wonderful. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotele”
Reviews.Author: tessuli
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a quadruple room in Hotel Atlanta am Kurfurstendamm for New Years. The room was big and clean and had it's own bathroom. Room was cleaned daily. The breakfast was enough to get the day started. The personnel at the hotel was ok. Location of the hotel is excellent, only about 100 meters to u-bahn Uhlandstrasse. Kurfurstendamm is also a 100 meters away. All in all it was a good deal to stay in Hotel Atlanta. Would most definetely recommend it to others and will most likely return.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in this somewhat jaded hotel. It is in a grand building but is a little worn, however, it is in a great location just off the Kudaam, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are exceptionally friendly. It was good value at only 73 euros per room, room 216 has a balcony where you can sit & have a drink & watch the world go by. If you want 5 star accomodation this is not the place for you but if you like good value and a good breakfast and treat this just as a comfortable base to explore Berlin then I would recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Atel Atlanta Am Kurfurstendamm
HotelInfo.Address: Fasanenstrasse 74, 10719 Berlin, Germany
